div.p: 2/137/5, Archer papers, University of Melbourne Archives.

I take the liberty, dear Mr Archer, to send the two enclosed letters from Mr Dallachy
Letters not found. for your own perusal, so that you may see, whether he is contented with his lot or shows reason of complaint. I can send you a host of letters written by the old gentleman in the same strain but these two came yesterday, as the envelopes show.

I will send old Mr Dallachy also one of the printed forms of the Civil Service Commission,
See parliamentary papers for 1870 or 1871 for published report of this commission. Perhaps there are also some unpublished papers somewhere?
but it will take at the least two months before they will be here back again and perhaps we have to wait double the time as there is no regular communication to Rockingham's Bay.

A number of my employees have put their heads together about filling up the printed forms. So the commission cannot receive the answers from all of my men as independent individual expressions of opinion.
Cite any relevant details from published report of the commission. I think the gardeners present a complaint that they are only paid daily and thus don't have any job security.
